Message:
The place I lived was
a largely barren region
where it was especially
difficult to grow anything.

Food was rationed.
There were days when
the food we received was less,

Peace had been restored
to Emeria at last,
so no one would
have to suffer anymore.

Everyone was full of hope,
believing that from now on,
we would all help one another.

But, as the rations we received
slowly grew smaller and smaller,
the atmosphere of the village
began to change...

The air turned tense,
like a loose string on a guitar
being slowly pulled tighter.

Wanting to lighten the mood,
I often sang together with
the other kids in the village.

I knew it wouldn’t change
the underlying cause
of our suffering.

But, I couldn’t just watch
and do nothing...
